bioghist.p: Udney Maria Blakeley was the daughter of Johnston and Jane Blakeley of Wilmington, North Carolina. Her father, a naval hero of the War of 1812, was lost at sea at the end of the war. Jane Blakeley was remarried in 1817 to Dr. Robert Abbot of Christiansted, St. Croix, and Maria was sent to school in Philadelphia. She finished her education in 1828, and joined her mother and stepfather in St. Croix, where she met Baron Joseph von Bretton, whom she married in 1841. She died the following year in childbirth.

scopecontent.p: This is a receipt book of payments for the expenses of Maria Blakeley. The money was paid by her guardian, Richard S. Smith, Esq., between 1825 to 1843. Payments are recorded as received by Mary and F.W. Hoope and others for board, washing, taxes, clothing, and other expenses.
